title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits, with changes made to the determination of benefit amounts. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and make changes to benefit amounts. A defined term is repealed and a conforming amendment is made to section 223 of the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and adjust benefit amounts. Section 223 of the Act is modified to define "Insured Status" and widow's insurance benefits based on disability are also addressed. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and adjust benefit amounts. Widow's insurance benefits based on disability are also addressed, with changes to the eligibility criteria. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and adjust benefit amounts. Widow's insurance benefits based on disability are also addressed, with changes to the eligibility criteria, including the redesignation of paragraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and adjust benefit amounts. Widow's insurance benefits based on disability are also addressed, with changes to the eligibility criteria and the redesignation of paragraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements. The Social Security Act is amended to remove the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements. Amendments include starting benefits for qualified railroad retirement beneficiaries earlier and removing the limit on the number of months benefits can be received. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability insurance and Medicare benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements and benefit limits. Amendments also include starting benefits for qualified railroad retirement beneficiaries earlier. Medicare coverage under the Social Security Act and entitlement to annuities under the Railroad Retirement Act have been amended to remove waiting periods and adjust benefit eligibility criteria. The effective dates for the amendments to Medicare coverage and entitlement to annuities have been specified. The amendments made by this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability under specific sections of the Social Security Act, starting from the third month after the enactment of the Act. The amendments in this Act apply to Social Security benefits for disability, with specific timelines for implementation. The amendments in this Act apply to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, with specific timelines for implementation.
